sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3}, B = {2, 3, 4}, and C = {3, 4, 5}. Find the set (A △ B) △ C and (A △ C) △ B, where △ denotes symmetric difference and × denotes Cartesian product. Show that (A △ B) △ C ≠ A △ (B △ C) with respect to Cartesian product.
